oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Guilford Dudley, Jr. and Tony Marvin, Nashville, Tennessee, between 1960 and 1979
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Nashville insurance executive Guilford Dudley, Jr. with Tony Marvin, an American radio and television announcer, interviewed on a Mutual Radio network program. Mr. Dudley was the son of Guilford Dudley, Sr., one of the original founders of Life and Casualty Insurance Company and Anne Dallas Dudley, a leading activist in the women’s suffrage movement in the United States. From 1952 until 1969 Dudley served as president of Life & Casualty Insurance Company. He also served as the United States ambassador to Denmark under the Nixon and Ford presidential administrations. Mr. Dudley was born and died in Nashville, Tennessee. He is buried in Mount Olivet Cemetery. Forms part of the Jerry Parker, Life and Casualty Insurance Company Collection. 1 b & w photograph.
